page.title: 13RESIDENTIAL USE OF FARMHOUSE
page.content: Pope's Farm is the name of the farmhouse built by Jacob Pope in 1844.At that time it was 47 acres and it was until recently a dairy farm.The farm and buildings are too small to be economical. It is now part of Bluegates Farm. A local Doctor and his family live there now. Like many Victorian houses they had their own well.Water is pumped from a bore hole.The old pump looked like a converted hand pump. It is a patent self oiling pump by H.L.Godwin of Quenington,Glos. In emergencies water can be obtained from a new pump house built for irrigating pasture and beet by Bluegates. It is sound insulated to stop the noise upsetting the villagers. Before permission for an old barn to be rebuilt could be granted they had to promise to replace an old Ordnance Survey Benchmark.
